Generate and Subset a XenaHub Object from XenaData

Source: R/download.R
XenaGenerate.Rd

Generate and Subset a XenaHub Object from XenaData

XenaGenerate(XenaData = UCSCXenaTools::XenaData, subset = TRUE)

Arguments

XenaData

a data.frame. Default is data(XenaData). The input of this argument can only be data(XenaData) or its subset.
subset

logical expression indicating elements or rows to keep.

Value

a XenaHub object.

Examples

# 1 get all datasets
XenaGenerate()
#> class: XenaHub 
#> hosts():
#>   https://ucscpublic.xenahubs.net
#>   https://tcga.xenahubs.net
#>   https://gdc.xenahubs.net
#>   https://icgc.xenahubs.net
#>   https://toil.xenahubs.net
#> cohorts() (131 total):
#>   1000_genomes
#>   Acute lymphoblastic leukemia (Mullighan 2008)
#>   B cells (Basso 2005)
#>   ...
#>   TCGA and TARGET Pan-Cancer (PANCAN)
#>   TCGA TARGET GTEx
#> datasets() (1521 total):
#>   1000_genomes/BRCA2
#>   1000_genomes/BRCA1
#>   mullighan2008_public/mullighan2008_500K_genomicMatrix
#>   ...
#>   TcgaTargetGtex_rsem_isoform_tpm
#>   TcgaTargetGtex_rsem_isopct
# 2
XenaGenerate(subset = XenaCohorts == "TCGA Breast Cancer (BRCA)")
#> class: XenaHub 
#> hosts():
#>   https://tcga.xenahubs.net
#> cohorts() (1 total):
#>   TCGA Breast Cancer (BRCA)
#> datasets() (30 total):
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.HiSeq
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.Agilent
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.HiSeq.V2
#>   ...
#>   TCGA.BRCA.sampleMap/Pathway_Paradigm_mRNA
#>   TCGA.BRCA.sampleMap/AgilentG4502A_07_3
# 3
XenaGenerate(subset = grepl("BRCA", XenaCohorts))
#> class: XenaHub 
#> hosts():
#>   https://tcga.xenahubs.net
#>   https://gdc.xenahubs.net
#> cohorts() (2 total):
#>   TCGA Breast Cancer (BRCA)
#>   GDC TCGA Breast Cancer (BRCA)
#> datasets() (43 total):
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.HiSeq
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.Agilent
#>   RABIT/separate_processed/RABIT_BRCA.HiSeq.V2
#>   ...
#>   TCGA-BRCA/Xena_Matrices/TCGA-BRCA.survival.tsv
#>   TCGA-BRCA/Xena_Matrices/TCGA-BRCA.varscan2_snv.tsv
# 4 use pipe

# NOT RUN {
library(tidyverse)
XenaData %>% filter(XenaHostNames == "TCGA", grepl("BRCA", XenaCohorts)) %>% XenaGenerate()
XenaData %>% filter(XenaHostNames == "TCGA", grepl("BRCA", XenaCohorts)) %>% XenaGenerate()
# }
